stripped_text: The first time each turn you make a successful run on HQ, you may choose 2 cards in your heap. If you do, the Corp removes 1 of those cards from the game, then you add the other card to your grip.
text: The first time each turn you make a successful run on HQ, you may choose 2 cards in your heap. If you do, the Corp removes 1 of those cards from the game, then you add the other card to your grip.
title: Steve Cambridge: Master Grifter

flavor: "Bypassing a system's defenses by cutting physical wires is what I like to call old school." - Steve Cambridge
stripped_text: As an additional cost to play this event, spend click. Derez a piece of ice that has a rez cost of X or lower.
text:
As an additional cost to play this event, spend [click].
Derez a piece of ice that has a rez cost of X or lower.
title: Brute-Force-Hack

flavor: Targeted attacks make system breaches so much easier, especially if you can spoof an authorized user.
stripped_text: Make a run. When you encounter the innermost piece of ice protecting that server, bypass it.
text: Make a run. When you encounter the innermost piece of ice protecting that server, bypass it.
title: Spear Phishing

flavor: Flooding the system with synchronized request messages makes it unresponsive to legitimate requests.
stripped_text: As an additional cost to play this event, spend click. The Corp must either discard 2 cards or draw 4 cards.
text:
As an additional cost to play this event, spend [click].
The Corp must either discard 2 cards or draw 4 cards.
title: SYN Attack

stripped_text: +1 mu, +1 link The first time each turn you pass all of the ice protecting HQ, you may draw 1 card to force the Corp to draw 1 card. Limit 1 console per player.
text: +1[mu], +1[link] The first time each turn you pass all of the ice protecting HQ, you may draw 1 card to force the Corp to draw 1 card. Limit 1 console per player.
title: Polyhistor

flavor: "Technology breeds crime."
stripped_text: Interface -> 1 credit: Break 1 code gate subroutine. 2 credits: +2 strength. trash: Bypass the code gate you are encountering.
text: Interface → 1[credit]: Break 1 code gate subroutine. 2[credit]: +2 strength. [trash]: Bypass the code gate you are encountering.
title: Abagnale

flavor: "Never boast. Just let your importance be quietly obvious."
stripped_text: Interface -> 1 credit: Break 1 sentry subroutine. 3 credits: +5 strength. trash: Bypass the sentry you are encountering.
text: Interface → 1[credit]: Break 1 sentry subroutine. 3[credit]: +5 strength. [trash]: Bypass the sentry you are encountering.
title: Lustig

flavor: "It's a matter of 'acquiring' the right credentials."
stripped_text: Interface -> 2 credits: Break up to 2 barrier subroutines. 2 credits: +3 strength. trash: Bypass the barrier you are encountering.
text: Interface → 2[credit]: Break up to 2 barrier subroutines. 2[credit]: +3 strength. [trash]: Bypass the barrier you are encountering.
title: Demara

stripped_text: Interface -> Hosted power counter: Break 1 subroutine. 2 credits: +2 strength. When your turn begins, you may pay X credits to place X power counters on this program. When your turn ends, remove all hosted power counters.
text: Interface → Hosted power counter: Break 1 subroutine. 2[credit]: +2 strength. When your turn begins, you may pay X[credit] to place X power counters on this program. When your turn ends, remove all hosted power counters.
title: Mammon

flavor: Know your mark, their weaknesses and strengths—both will show how to best bypass their defenses.
stripped_text: click click: Run any server. The first time you approach a rezzed piece of ice during this run, you may pay credits equal to the strength of that ice. If you do, when you encounter that ice after this approach, bypass it.
text: [click][click]: Run any server. The first time you approach a rezzed piece of ice during this run, you may pay credits equal to the strength of that ice. If you do, when you encounter that ice after this approach, bypass it.
title: Charlatan

flavor: You remember when Maxi was making book for Chacon. He's moved up in the world and gained the veneer of respectability. But as an executive the people he works for now, are far more vicious, bloodthirsty, and crooked.
stripped_text: +1 link trash: Derez a piece of ice protecting a remote server. Use this ability only during the next paid ability window after a successful run on HQ ends. Errata from FAQ 4.2.
text:
+1[link]
[trash]: Derez a piece of ice protecting a remote server. Use this ability only during the next paid ability window after a successful run on HQ ends.
<errata>Errata from FAQ 4.2</errata>.
title: Maxwell James

stripped_text: Before drawing your starting hand, set aside the top 6 cards of your stack facedown. (You may look at those cards at any time.) Shuffle 2 of those cards into your stack. click: Add 1 card set aside with this identity to your grip.
text: Before drawing your starting hand, set aside the top 6 cards of your stack facedown. (You may look at those cards at any time.) Shuffle 2 of those cards into your stack. [click]: Add 1 card set aside with this identity to your grip.
title: Ayla "Bios" Rahim: Simulant Specialist

flavor: Each AI had been tasked with finding a solution to the same problem but with different variables.
stripped_text: Play only as your first click. Choose 1 card installed in the root of or protecting a remote server. That card cannot be rezzed this turn.
text:
Play only as your first [click].
Choose 1 card installed in the root of or protecting a remote server. That card cannot be rezzed this turn.
title: Careful Planning

flavor: Extracting data from complex systems is what running is all about.
stripped_text: Run R&D. If successful, access X additional cards when you breach R&D. X is equal to your unused MU or 4, whichever is less.
text: Run R&D. If successful, access X additional cards when you breach R&D. X is equal to your unused MU or 4, whichever is less.
title: Deep Data Mining

flavor: It is not literally made of diamonds, but it is worth several times its weight in them.
stripped_text: +1 mu, +1 link Your maximum hand size is increased by 1.
text:
+1[mu], +1[link]
Your maximum hand size is increased by 1.
title: LLDS Memory Diamond

flavor: "It is more than just a 'pretty nanite plant'. It's a complex synthetic intelligent distributed network, and a VERY pretty nanite plant." - Bios
stripped_text: +1 mu When your turn begins, draw 1 card. Limit 1 console per player.
text: +1[mu] When your turn begins, draw 1 card. Limit 1 console per player.
title: Ubax

flavor: Μεγάλο μέρος της μάθησης δεν διδάσκει την κατανόηση
stripped_text: This program gets +1 strength for each unused MU. Interface -> 2 credits: Break 1 sentry or barrier subroutine.
text: This program gets +1 strength for each unused MU. Interface → 2[credit]: Break 1 sentry or barrier subroutine.
title: Adept

flavor: Δεν υπἁρχει τίποτα μόνιμο, εκτός από την αλλαγή.
stripped_text: This program gets +1 strength for each unused MU. Interface -> 2 credits: Break 1 sentry or 2 code gate subroutines.
text: This program gets +1 strength for each unused MU. Interface → 2[credit]: Break 1 sentry or 2 code gate subroutines.
title: Savant

stripped_text: Install only on a rezzed piece of ice. Host ice gains barrier, code gate, and sentry.
text: Install only on a rezzed piece of ice. Host ice gains barrier, code gate, and sentry.
title: Egret

stripped_text: You can install other programs onto this program. Each program installed this way costs 1 credit less to install. Limit 1 hosted program. The memory cost of the hosted program does not count against your memory limit.
text:
You can install other programs onto this program. Each program installed this way costs 1[credit] less to install. Limit 1 hosted program.
The memory cost of the hosted program does not count against your memory limit.
title: Dhegdheer

flavor: Innovation. Iteration. Education.
stripped_text: click: Reveal the top 4 cards of your stack. If any of those cards are programs, you may add 1 to your grip. Add the rest of the cards to the bottom of your stack in any order.
text: [click]: Reveal the top 4 cards of your stack. If any of those cards are programs, you may add 1 to your grip. Add the rest of the cards to the bottom of your stack in any order.
title: Levy Advanced Research Lab

flavor: One of the wealthiest and most powerful areas of New Angeles, Laguna Velasco is also known as the Government District.
stripped_text: Whenever you take the basic action to draw cards, increase the number of cards you draw by 1.
text: Whenever you take the basic action to draw cards, increase the number of cards you draw by 1.
title: Laguna Velasco District

flavor: Restructuring labor resources.
stripped_text: Gain 2 credits and draw 1 card.
text: Gain 2[credit] and draw 1 card.
title: Process Automation

stripped_text: trash, 1 credit: The Corp trashes 2 cards from HQ at random. Use this ability only if you suffered meat damage this turn.
text: [trash], 1[credit]: The Corp trashes 2 cards from HQ at random. Use this ability only if you suffered meat damage this turn.
title: Officer Frank

flavor: Although he rarely teaches classes these days, his lectures are always well attended.
stripped_text: trash: Choose an icebreaker. Until the end of the run, that icebreaker has +1 strength for each card in your grip.
text: [trash]: Choose an icebreaker. Until the end of the run, that icebreaker has +1 strength for each card in your grip.
title: Dean Lister

flavor: She left behind an encrypted trail leading to some random employee for a rival corp. She knew lazy sysops would work just hard enough to figure it out and wouldn't bother looking any deeper.
stripped_text: trash: Prevent 2 damage.
text: [trash]: Prevent 2 damage.
title: Biometric Spoofing

flavor: A despicable web of outcasts and infamy, no government or corporation could effectively shut it down. If only because so many of their sysops, executives, and covert agents made use of it.
stripped_text: click, forfeit an agenda: Play an event from your heap, ignoring all costs.
text: [click], forfeit an agenda: Play an event from your heap, ignoring all costs.
title: The Shadow Net

flavor: Interweaving the Past and the Future.
stripped_text: The first time each turn the Runner loses or spends click during a run, you may add 1 card from Archives to the top of R&D.
text: The first time each turn the Runner loses or spends [click] during a run, you may add 1 card from Archives to the top of R&D.
title: Seidr Laboratories: Destiny Defined

flavor: The black level clearance sub-sub-basement of Haas-Bioroid is a magical place.
stripped_text: When you score Brain Rewiring, you may pay X credits to force the Runner to add X cards from his or her grip to the bottom of his or her stack at random then draw 1 card.
text: When you score Brain Rewiring, you may pay X[credit] to force the Runner to add X cards from his or her grip to the bottom of his or her stack at random then draw 1 card.
title: Brain Rewiring

stripped_text: Place 2 agenda counters on Elective Upgrade when you score it. click, hosted agenda counter: Gain click click. Use this ability only once per turn.
text: Place 2 agenda counters on Elective Upgrade when you score it. [click], hosted agenda counter: Gain [click][click]. Use this ability only once per turn.
title: Elective Upgrade

stripped_text: When you score Successful Field Test, install any number of cards from HQ, ignoring all costs.
text: When you score Successful Field Test, install any number of cards from HQ, ignoring all costs.
title: Successful Field Test

stripped_text: Whenever you install a card in the root of a remote server, place 1 power counter on this asset. trash: For each power counter on this asset, gain 2 credits and draw 1 card.
text: Whenever you install a card in the root of a remote server, place 1 power counter on this asset. [trash]: For each power counter on this asset, gain 2[credit] and draw 1 card.
title: Estelle Moon

stripped_text: When you rez this asset, load 8 credits onto it. When it is empty, trash it. When your turn begins, take 2 credits from this asset. Interrupt -> When this asset would be trashed, you may shuffle it into R&D instead of adding it to Archives. (It is still considered trashed.)
text: When you rez this asset, load 8[credit] onto it. When it is empty, trash it. When your turn begins, take 2[credit] from this asset. [interrupt] → When this asset would be trashed, you may shuffle it into R&D instead of adding it to Archives. (It is still considered trashed.)
title: Marilyn Campaign

flavor: "A new game means new rules..."
stripped_text: Lose click click: Break up to 2 subroutines on this ice. Only the Runner can use this ability. Subroutine You may draw 1 card. Subroutine End the run. Subroutine End the run.
text: Lose [click][click]: Break up to 2 subroutines on this ice. Only the Runner can use this ability. [subroutine] You may draw 1 card. [subroutine] End the run. [subroutine] End the run.
title: Eli 2.0

flavor: "Strictly speaking, it isn't illegal to use an interrogation simulator as the blueprint for ICE." - Mason Bellamy
stripped_text: Subroutine Trace[4]. If successful, do 1 brain damage.
text: [subroutine] Trace[4]. If successful, do 1 brain damage.
title: Executive Functioning

stripped_text: Subroutine Trace[4]. If successful, the Runner cannot access cards or breach the attacked server for the remainder of this run. Subroutine Trash 1 installed icebreaker.
text: [subroutine] Trace[4]. If successful, the Runner cannot access cards or breach the attacked server for the remainder of this run. [subroutine] Trash 1 installed icebreaker.
title: Holmegaard

flavor: "The Warp and Weft were hypnotic...but they didn't really seem to do anything to keep me out. But then I never seemed to find anything interesting either." - Reaver
stripped_text: Subroutine The Runner loses click, if able. Subroutine The Corp may draw 1 card. Subroutine The Corp may add 1 card from HQ to the top of R&D.
text:
[subroutine] The Runner loses [click], if able.
[subroutine] The Corp may draw 1 card.
[subroutine] The Corp may add 1 card from HQ to the top of R&D.
title: Tapestry

flavor: "If there were hidden partitions on the server, I'd know; I'm the head of this department!"
stripped_text: As an additional cost to play this operation, spend click click. Gain 10 credits and draw 4 cards. You may install 1 card from HQ.
text:
As an additional cost to play this operation, spend [click][click].
Gain 10[credit] and draw 4 cards. You may install 1 card from HQ.
title: Ultraviolet Clearance

flavor: Even knowing this floor existed was cause for termination...
stripped_text: Whenever there is a successful run on this server, the Runner must either take 1 brain damage or jack out. If the Runner jacks out, gain 5 credits, draw 1 card, and trash Black Level Clearance.
text: Whenever there is a successful run on this server, the Runner must either take 1 brain damage or jack out. If the Runner jacks out, gain 5[credit], draw 1 card, and trash Black Level Clearance.
title: Black Level Clearance

flavor: "They say he is an ex-runner. I don't know if it is true, but he is chromed to the gills and seems to know all the runners' tricks."
stripped_text: Whenever an encounter with a piece of ice protecting this server ends in which the Runner broke at least one subroutine, he or she loses click, if able.
text: Whenever an encounter with a piece of ice protecting this server ends in which the Runner broke at least one subroutine, he or she loses [click], if able.
title: Mason Bellamy

flavor: Might makes right.
stripped_text: Interrupt -> Whenever 1 or more Runner cards would be trashed (from any location), set those cards aside instead of adding them to the heap. You can look at those cards. You may remove 1 of them from the game. Then, add all of those cards that are still set aside to the heap. Ignore this ability if you have already removed a card from the game with it this turn. Errata from CR 1.4
text: [interrupt] → Whenever 1 or more Runner cards would be trashed (from any location), set those cards aside instead of adding them to the heap. You can look at those cards. You may remove 1 of them from the game. Then, add all of those cards that are still set aside to the heap. Ignore this ability if you have already removed a card from the game with it this turn. Errata from CR 1.4
title: Skorpios Defense Systems: Persuasive Power

stripped_text: Place 1 agenda counter on Armored Servers when you score it. Hosted agenda counter: For the remainder of this run, the Runner must trash a card from his or her grip as an additional cost to jack out or break a subroutine. Use this ability only during a run.
text: Place 1 agenda counter on Armored Servers when you score it. Hosted agenda counter: For the remainder of this run, the Runner must trash a card from his or her grip as an additional cost to jack out or break a subroutine. Use this ability only during a run.
title: Armored Servers

flavor: "Anything, to anyone...for the right price."
stripped_text: When you score Illicit Sales, you may take 1 bad publicity. Gain 3 credits for each bad publicity that you have.
text: When you score Illicit Sales, you may take 1 bad publicity. Gain 3[credit] for each bad publicity that you have.
title: Illicit Sales

stripped_text: When you score Graft, you may search your deck for up to 3 cards, reveal them, and add them to HQ. Shuffle R&D.
text: When you score Graft, you may search your deck for up to 3 cards, reveal them, and add them to HQ. Shuffle R&D.
title: Graft

stripped_text: If the Runner trashes Illegal Arms Factory while it is installed, take 1 bad publicity. When your turn begins, gain 1 credit and draw 1 card.
text:
If the Runner trashes Illegal Arms Factory while it is installed, take 1 bad publicity.
When your turn begins, gain 1[credit] and draw 1 card.
title: Illegal Arms Factory

flavor:
"VP of Retirements and Pensions? So is that HR or Accounting?"
"Both."
stripped_text: Whenever the Runner takes 1 or more tags, do 1 meat damage.
text: Whenever the Runner takes 1 or more tags, do 1 meat damage.
title: Mr. Stone

stripped_text: Subroutine The Runner must either trash 1 program or trash the top 2 cards from his or her stack.
text: [subroutine] The Runner must either trash 1 program or trash the top 2 cards from his or her stack.
title: Bloodletter

stripped_text: You can advance this ice. It has +1 strength for each hosted advancement token. Subroutine Give the Runner 1 tag. If there are 3 or more hosted advancement tokens, instead give the Runner 2 tags. Subroutine Trash 1 installed program. If there are 3 or more hosted advancement tokens, instead trash 1 installed program and 1 installed resource.
text:
You can advance this ice. It has +1 strength for each hosted advancement token.
[subroutine] Give the Runner 1 tag. If there are 3 or more hosted advancement tokens, instead give the Runner 2 tags.
[subroutine] Trash 1 installed program. If there are 3 or more hosted advancement tokens, instead trash 1 installed program and 1 installed resource.
title: Colossus

stripped_text: Subroutine Remove a card in the heap from the game. Subroutine End the run.
text:
[subroutine] Remove a card in the heap from the game.
[subroutine] End the run.
title: Hailstorm

stripped_text: You can advance this ice. If there are 3 or more hosted advancement counters, the Runner cannot break subroutines on this ice using AI programs. Subroutine Gain 1 credit. If there are 3 or more hosted advancement counters, instead gain 4 credits. Subroutine End the run. If there are 3 or more hosted advancement counters, instead search R&D for up to 2 cards. Add those cards to HQ, then end the run.
text: You can advance this ice. If there are 3 or more hosted advancement counters, the Runner cannot break subroutines on this ice using AI programs. [subroutine] Gain 1[credit]. If there are 3 or more hosted advancement counters, instead gain 4[credit]. [subroutine] End the run. If there are 3 or more hosted advancement counters, instead search R&D for up to 2 cards. Add those cards to HQ, then end the run.
title: Hortum

stripped_text: As an additional cost to play this operation, spend click. Play only if the Runner stole an agenda during his or her last turn. Trash 1 card.
text:
As an additional cost to play this operation, spend [click].
Play only if the Runner stole an agenda during his or her last turn.
Trash 1 card.
title: Hunter Seeker

stripped_text: Whenever the Runner passes all of the ice protecting this server, he or she must either take 1 tag or end the run.
text: Whenever the Runner passes all of the ice protecting this server, he or she must either take 1 tag or end the run.
title: K. P. Lynn

stripped_text: When you score Paper Trail, trace 6 If successful, trash all connection and job resources.
text: When you score Paper Trail, trace 6 If successful, trash all connection and job resources.
title: Paper Trail

text:
If Honeyfarm is accessed from R&D, the Runner must reveal it.
When the Runner accesses Honeyfarm, he or she loses 1[credit].
title: Honeyfarm

stripped_text: When your turn begins, place 2 credits on Long-Term Investment. If there are at least 8 credits on Long-Term Investment, it gains "click: Take any number of credits from Long-Term Investment."
text: When your turn begins, place 2[credit] on Long-Term Investment. If there are at least 8[credit] on Long-Term Investment, it gains "[click]: Take any number of credits from Long-Term Investment."
title: Long-Term Investment

text:
[subroutine] The Runner loses [click], if able
[subroutine] The Runner trashes 1 card from his or her grip.
title: Weir

text:
After you resolve this operation, end your action phase.
